section.title: Adaptive Monitoring
section.para: &name-icinga; allows you to change certain commands and host and service check attributes during runtime. I'll refer to this feature as "adaptive monitoring". Please note that the adaptive monitoring features found in &name-icinga; will probably not be of much use to 99% of users, but they do allow you to do some neat things.

section.para: In order to change global or host- or service-specific attributes during runtime, you must submit the appropriate external command to &name-icinga; via the external command file. The table below lists the different attributes that may be changed during runtime, along with the external command to accomplish the job.
A full listing of external commands that can be used for adaptive monitoring can be found in the list of external commands.

listitem.para: When changing check commands, check timeperiods, or event handler commands, it is important to note that the new values for these options must have been defined before &name-icinga; was started. Any request to change a command or timeperiod to one which had not been defined when &name-icinga; was started is ignored.

You can specify command arguments along with the actual command name - just separate individual arguments from the command name (and from each other) using bang (!) characters. More information on how arguments in command definitions are processed during runtime can be found in the documentation on macros.
